intro: Triceros xalapensis, commonly known as the Xalapa trichocarp, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered flower heads. Triceros xalapensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
